comments.body: This is being moved to the PRDS site. I'm tracking this #3, and I'm closing this PR. @jrgriffiniii or @matthewjchandler let me know if I misunderstood, and I'll reopen!

dataspace-jspui.title: Direct Help and About links to PRDS site

comments.body: This content is being moved to the PRDS site. We will now point the "About" and "Help" tabs to the new PRDS pages. When PRDS has finished creating these pages, @matthewchandler will comment their links, and I will update the JSPUI to redirect the tabs to those links
The "About" page is already published on the PRDS site: https://researchdata.princeton.edu/research-lifecycle-guide/about-dataspace

Note that the [documentation](https://wiki.lyrasis.org/display/DSDOC5x/JSPUI+Configuration+and+Customization) indicates that the "Messages.properties" file would be under the "dspace-jspui" directory, but it is in fact under the "dspace-api" directory.
The relevant message is called "org.dspace.app.webui.jsptag.ItemTag.embargo", located on line 1582 in "Messages.properties"

The updated message is: `This content is embargoed until {0}. For questions about theses and dissertations, please contact the Mudd Manuscript Library. For questions about research datasets, as well as all other inquiries, please contact the DataSpace curators.`
Lynn Durgin was contacted to confirm that this language update is appropriate. @matthewjchandler or @neggink, please provide an embargoed work so that I can test that my changes are reflected.
PRDS doesn't currently have any datasets under embargo through Dataspace. We'll have to create one or find theses / dissertations.

comments.body: PRDS is unfamiliar with this request, presumably this is a request from Lynn

dspace-development.title: Remove e-mail notifications issued from dspadmin@princeton.edu for DataSpace import procedures

comments.body:
In dataspace, the config file is `princeton-5/prod.properties`. I believe we need to change:
```
# Recipient for server errors and alerts
#mail.alert.recipient = email-address-here
mail.alert.recipient= dspaceadmin@princeton.libanswers.com
```
Double checking with Atmire that changing this won't cause unexpected errors.

@matthewjchandler please confirm whether or not dspaceadmin@princeton.libanswers.com is forwarded to dspaceadmin@princeton.edu.
Sorry, I don't know what those email addresses are. The only email address I'm aware of is dspadmin@princeton.edu

I've just sent an email to dspaceadmin@princeton.libanswers.com testing whether it's aliased to dspadmin@princeton.edu

Would you mind checking dspadmin@princteon.edu for an email with the subject line "TEST FROM KEVIN"?
Nothing within 10 minutes, so these addresses are probably not aliases

figgy.title: Harvest data from ecodices OAI-PMH endpoints

comments.body:
This is ready for review. It's deployed and can be tested with a curl command like:

```
curl -d "auth_token=[htc_auth_token]" -X POST "https://bibdata-alma-staging.princeton.edu/bibliographic/9968643943506421/holdings/22258767470006421/items/23258767460006421"
```

The auth token is in the shared lastpass drive at location `Shared-ITIMS-Passwords/bibdata/htc_auth_token`

Can we index the 050 and 090? Indexing the 050/090 lc call_number from the bib record.

comments.body: Closing this issue. Discussed with dssg and there are better ways to get an analytics report directly through alma.

marc_liberation.title: Update all the fixtures with the removal of the enrichment fields 876 i and 876 h

comments.body:
The enrichment fields in alma specifies 876 | h as: call_number subfield. This is why based on the current codebase it indexes the call number. This should be fixed.

In voyager an 876 | h would expect to have 'In library use', 'Supervised Use' or nothing. The logic is based on the locations in subfield z. Do we need to add 876 enrichment field | z? 

Update: We discussed this in the alma checkin and we removed from all the publishing jobs the `876 | h` and `876 | i` subfields.
 Publishing jobs that it was removed: General Publishing via FTP, Incremental Publishing via FTP, Sample Record FTP export, Test record export
I will update all the fixtures tomorrow .

@kevinreiss What about "sortable_call_number"? I don't think we have implemented that for the alma endpoint. Will we need to?

We're sending it a callnumber, but the endpoint currently provides both call number and sortable call number. Does it need both?

pulfalight.title: Adds Princeton non-affiliated language to Research Account instructions.
Clarify that only non-Princeton users need to create a Research Account
Statement on Archival Language links

comments.body: Hi @sdellis - where did you add the link to the harmful language statement? Don't think I'm seeing it?
@faithc it's under "Research Help", which aggregates other statements, policies, and guides in one place.

Right, yes, that will be the statement's home, but staff were wondering if we could add a persistent link to that statement on every page of the site for heightened visibility. That's why we were wondering if a link could be added to the bottom navigation bar or somewhere else you think might be appropriate. Thanks.

That statement does not currently have a persistent link. We will need to give the statement it's own page to do this. Should all of the statements under Research Help have persistent links? Perhaps the footer would be a better place for this information. Right now it has a lot of links that don't have much to do with archives and special collections.

Ah, perhaps it should have it's own page then. And yes, it seems like all of the content here should perhaps have their own pages. @ccleeton? At least for now, I think the statement on harmful language should. And yeah, there's a LOT going on in the footer. Does all of that need to be there? I worry that the link to the harmful language statement will be lost if it's added there.

That is the standard Library footer, but we can change the links/sections to be whatever we want. I think that's the most appropriate place. It would be appropriate to put in the nav with "Ask a Question" and "Make A Correction" if it's a _call to action_, such as "Report Harmful Language". You ask users to do this in the statement, which can be included in the form instructions for context.

Also, can you clarify the title for me? You're referring to it as a "Statement on Harmful Language" but it's referred to in the site and in the title of this issue as a "Statement on Archival Language". "Statement on Harmful Language" seems a more appropriate title for the content, but I want to confirm with you.

Ok, we're asking folks to use Suggest a Correction to report harmful language so it's not actionable in that sense. (Actually, we may ask that the message for the suggest a correction form be updated to reflect this.) Maybe we could add a section footer titled something like "About Archival Collections"? 

And sorry, not sure why I keep changing the statement's title; "Statement on Archival Language" is correct.

Just had a meeting with the Inclusive Description WG, and there's consensus about adding a section "About Archival Collections" to the footer with a link to the statement. Folks mentioned that other content would be appropriate to add to that section at a later date.
@faithc thank you for pulling the details together so quickly. I have enough to work with now. üëç

comments.body: From a quick search, this looks better to me; though I'm a bit nervous about the fact that the number of results for some searches differ drastically between pulfalight and pulfa2, for example, doing a keyword search for Toni Morrison. But maybe that's because the indexing functionality for the former is better? I wonder if we should keep this open while colleagues continue to test it out; in case they discover issues we may be missing.
@faithc Can we just open a new issue if someone finds more relevancy problems? Keeping an issue open with no clear way to close it makes it hard to track when the blocking issues are done.
Sure, that makes sense. We can close it then if @ccleeton is cool with that.

For voyager hold requests on the "sa" location Marquand circk desk pick-up information will be (from @mzelesky): 

```The code for the circ desk is 'sacirc', which is location_id 321```

@kevinreiss Just to be certain I have all the cases correct.
For In Library Use:
   * Available, in Clancy
       1. request from clancy 
       1. Add hold to 'sacirc' 
   * Not Available, in Clancy
       1.  Email Marquand
   * Available, not in Clancy
       1. Add hold to 'sacirc' 
   * Not Available, not in Clancy
       1.  Email Marquand

What should we do about the small number of circulating items?

I believe at this point we do not know about digitizing.
I think these are all correct.
